p: The seasons with the highest numbers of hospitalization days were the two A(H3N2) dominant seasons. Over the five seasons, the ≥80 years totalized 39% of the hospitalization days, followed by the 60‐79 years (30%). The part of elderly (≥60 years) was particularly high in 2016‐2017, as they totalized 86% of the hospitalization days (Figure 4).
